refnamediv.refpurpose: Registering grid resources to MDS services such as the Index and Trigger services

refsect1.title: Tool description
refsect1.para: mds-servicegroup-add creates a set of registrations to a WS-ServiceGroup and periodically renews those registrations. It is intended primarily for registering grid resources to MDS services such as the index and trigger services. [todo: do aggregator sources fit into this definition?]
Registrations are defined in an XML configuration file, which is documented below.

refsect1.title: Command syntax
refsect1.para: The basic syntax for mds-servicegroup-add is: mds-servicegroup-add -s http://foo [options] config.xml where:

row.entry: This dummy option is required but ignored. A URL to the service group against which the mds-servicegroup-add request will be executed. This command line argument is a required argument, however it is only necessary that this URL argument evaluate to a valid EPR in the case that there are no suitable target service group EPRs present in the configuration file. Any end point references found in the configuration file will automatically override the EPR specified on the command-line.

entry.para: By default, mds-servicegroup-add will attempt to make an authenticated connection to each service group. This option is used to specify anonymous connections (and to prevent mds-servicegroup-add from failing if you don't have a valid Grid credential).

listitem.para: Fail if the server's identity is different from the user's identity.
Fail if the server does not have a valid server certificate.
Continue regardless of the server's identity.

entry.para: Path to the registration configuration file.
The Globus Toolkit distribution includes an example configuration file: $GLOBUS_LOCATION/etc/globus_wsrf_mds_aggregator/example-aggregator-registration.xml.

refsect1.para: The other standard toolkit options [TODO -- link to standard options page??] are also supported.

refsect1.title: Prerequisites for registering a remote service
refsect1.para: You need the following before you register a remote service with an Index Service:

note.simpara: With GT 4.0.1, the CAS, RFT and WS GRAM services are automatically registered with the default Index Service. [link to appropro thang]

itemizedlist.listitem: Have a working Index Service, as documented in the main [Index Service administrators guide].
Know the URL to the remote service.

Know the URL to the Index Service. This can be seen in the container output at startup of the container on the index host, and will look something like this: https://myhost:8443/wsrf/services/DefaultIndexService

refsect1.title: Simple usage for the Index Service
refsect1.para: The simplest way to register services to an index is to:

orderedlist.listitem: Edit the example configuration file ($GLOBUS_LOCATION/etc/globus_wsrf_mds_aggregator/example-aggregator-registration.xml), replacing the EPRs in that file with the EPRs for your resources
Run mds-servicegroup-add to perform the registrations specified in that file.

refsect1.title: Limitations
refsect1.para: It is necessary for the tool to continue to run in order for the registrations that it maintains to be kept alive, as registrations will otherwise time out.
